page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY - PLACE NAMES
page.content:
{LOCAL PLACE NAMES - DERIVATIONS }
{STUBBINS}- 1563 - cleared land {EDENFIELD}- 1324 - village or homestead in an island {SHUTTLEWORTH}- 1227 - enclosure made of bars {(RIVER)IRWELL} - 1200 - winding stream (IR from "irre" meaning "angry") {RAMSBOTTOM}- 1324 - wild garlic valley {LUMB}- 1534 - pool {CHATTERTON}- 1224 - hill-fort (obscure but possible) {HARCLES HILL}- (first date unknown) - the hill of the hawk {HOLCOMBE}-1236 - hollow (combe or ravine) {STRONGSTRY}- (first date unknown) - two possible meanings - Strong's Tree (from a local family) or Strong Stride (needed to cross the River Irwell)
